poem:
Title: Songs of Stone

In Kathmandu's heart, Adhikari poured
Over papers; truth separately stored.
Laxmi, Narayan - far adrift -
In Dallas, their eyes a sacred gift.

"Sleep fled that night," he softly mourned,
"Their silence by foreign hands scorned.
Our silent gods, in glass and steel,
Echo an unacknowledged reel."

Hear their call in the shifting breeze,
Let history's custody appease.
